result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Lee Gerard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to successfully complete OWI Court.

timeConds.notes: Jail time imposed; to be served at the discretion of the OWI Court.  Huber granted, 14 hours per day.  Defendant required to contact the diversion office at (608) 373-3880 within 3 days.

records.addlTxt: 8:31 AM Defendant Kevin Lee Gerard in court in person with attorney David Kennedy Anderson in person.  David Zarwell appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Parties to file OWI Court Contract within 2 weeks. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds the defendant guilty. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders sentence withheld 2 years probation. As conditions of probation, defendant is to complete OWI Court and serve 29 days conditional jail at the discretion of OWI Court. Full Huber. Driver's license revoked for 24 months and IID for 24 months.  Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. A fine of $600 and costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit zero days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Letter from attorney Anderson
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Activity:  Waiver of preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

08:32 AM Defendant Kevin Lee Gerard in court by video with attorney David Kennedy Anderson by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Noah M Tylenda and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $500.00 with conditions: Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or without valid insurance. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse on April 6, 2022 between 12 and 1PM. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom and scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 8:30 AM, time limits were waived.
